Class Project1

java.lang.Object
Project1
public class Project1 extends Object
COP3530: Project 1 - Array Searches and Sorts

Class Project1 involves sorting and searching arrays. Input of a file is needed, which is then converted into an array and used to do various requirements, such as sorting by name, or calculating Kendall's Tau-b Correlation. Project1 uses an array of countries and manipulates that data as needed.

Project1 requires an input file and outputs that information either as a report, sorted by name, sorted by Happiness Index, or sorted by GDP per capita. Furthermore, this class allows the user to find and print a certain country and prints Kendall's Tau-b correlation between GDPPC, APC, and the Happiness Index.

Project1 uses various methods to complete these requirements and some methods use other methods to get the job done.

Version:
09/13/2023
Author:
Emma Choi

  • Constructor Details

    • Project1

      public Project1()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Method main takes in a file, reads the file, and converts each element into a Country object. It lists how many records were read and includes a switch case to allow the user to choose what they would like to be done to the data from a menu of options. Based on the user's input, respective methods are called.
      Parameters:
      args - an array of command-line arguments.

    • printCountriesReport

      public static void printCountriesReport(Country[] countriesArray)
      Method printCountriesReport uses countriesArray to print each Country object in the array. As long as c (the Country object) is not empty (null), the method will print the country in a certain format by using the getter methods in Country.java.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.

    • sortByName

      public static void sortByName(Country[] countriesArray)
      Method sortByName uses countriesArray and sorts the countries in alphabetical order using Insertion Sort. It uses inner and outer to keep track of the order in which the countries are being moved, and compares a temporary Country object to the current Country object (countriesArray[inner]) and determines whether either needs to be moved. Finally, a message is printed to the user that the countries are now sorted by name.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.

    • sortByHappyIndex

      public static void sortByHappyIndex(Country[] countriesArray)
      Method sortByHappyIndex sorts the countriesArray elements in ascending order by their Happiness Index number. It uses Selection Sort to do so.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.

    • sortByGdp

      public static void sortByGdp(Country[] countriesArray)
      Method sortByGdp uses Bubble Sort to sort countriesArray by GDP per capita (GDPPC) in ascending order. To get GDPPC, the method divides GDP by population, using the getter methods from Country.java. It uses a boolean variable to execute the do-while loop, which sorts using Bubble Sort. Finally, a message is printed to the user that the countries have been sorted by GDPPC.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.

    • printGivenCountry

      public static void printGivenCountry(Country[] countriesArray)
      Method printGivenCountry allows the user to enter a country name. If the name is not correct, an error will print. Otherwise, the program will search and print the user's entered country using either Binary Search or Sequential Search. There are a few conditions to this method.

      If the data is sorted by name, i.e., then the method will find the user's input (a country name) using Binary Search. Otherwise, the program will find the user's country through Sequential Search. Then, the program will print that country's information.

      Three other methods are used to complete this method, isSortedByName, binarySearch, and sequentialSearch.

      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.

    • isSortedByName

      public static boolean isSortedByName(Country[] countriesArray)
      Method isSortedByName determines whether the countriesArray is sorted alphabetically. It will return false if the comparison of country name's is greater than zero, and true otherwise.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.
      Returns:
      true or false.

    • binarySearch

      public static int binarySearch(Country[] countriesArray, String userInput)
      Method binarySearch completes a binary search using the array of countries and user input, which would be the needed country name as asked for in method printGivenCountry.

      If the country is found right away, the variable middle is returned, which is the array index. Otherwise, the binary search continues. If the country is not found, negative 1 is returned.

      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.
      userInput - the name of the country.
      Returns:
      negative 1 or variable middle (array index).

    • sequentialSearch

      public static int sequentialSearch(Country[] countriesArray, String userInput)
      Method sequentialSearch runs a sequential search for the user's inputed country. Using the array of countries and the user input, if the country is found the method will return i (which would be the index at found country), otherwise it will return negative 1, indicating the country has not been found.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.
      userInput - the name of the country.
      Returns:
      negative 1 or i (array index).

    • printKendallsMatrix

      public static void printKendallsMatrix(Country[] countriesArray)
      Method printKendallsMatrix uses the array of countries and 2 other methods to complete the calculation of Kendall's Tau-b Correlation. It uses the ascending rankings of GDPPC and APC in relation to the Happiness Index score.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.

    • calcRank

      public static int[] calcRank(Country[] countriesArray, String s)
      Method calcRank uses the array of countries and a String s (representing GDPPC, APC, or Happiness Index) to gather the necessary data for completing the Kendall's Correlation. If s were to be GDPPC, for example, then the GDP data is gathered using the getters in Country.java. The method then ranks the country data.
      Parameters:
      countriesArray - an array of Country objects.
      s - String representing the data of either GDPPC, APC, or Happiness Index.
      Returns:
      ranks of data

    • calcKendalls

      public static double calcKendalls(int[] ranks1, int[] happyIndexRank)
      Method calcKendalls calculates Kendall's Correlation through the use of 2 integer arrays. The array ranks1 takes in either the GDPPC numbers or the APC numbers, which are then compared to happyIndexRank respectively. The amount of 'agrees' and 'disagrees' are counted, and the final result is calculated within the return statement.
      Parameters:
      ranks1 - GDPPC ranks or APC ranks
      happyIndexRank - Happiness Index ranks
      Returns:
      Kendall's Tau-b Correlation
